description:
Actinomyces bouchesdurhonensis is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Actinomyces. Actinomyces are Gram-positive, anaerobic or microaerophilic, and filamentous bacteria that are commonly found in the human oral cavity and gastrointestinal tract.

Actinomyces bouchesdurhonensis was first isolated from a human clinical sample collected in the Bouches-du-Rh√¥ne region of France. It is a slow-growing, non-spore-forming bacterium that forms branching, filamentous colonies. Biochemical and genetic analyses have been used to differentiate this species from other Actinomyces species.

The exact ecological roles and pathogenic potential of Actinomyces bouchesdurhonensis are not yet fully understood, as it is a relatively newly described species. Further research is needed to elucidate its natural habitat, interactions with the human microbiome, and any potential involvement in human disease processes.
